title: How to write a grade appeal letter to an instructor - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are in high school, go to the teach first. If that isn’ satifactory, I suggest a letter to the academic principal. If in college, I’d go straight to the Dean of your academic major and CC the chair of the department. I advise this because a grade change would go thtough them anyway. Chances are there is a grade change form that requires signatures. In either case, be sure to include the reason(s) for your challenge beyond stating your grade was unfair. If you don’t have cause or a solid reason, I wouldn’t bother. As a long time teacher, if I had ＄5 for every student who said their grade was unfair, I’d have retired long ago.
Start with praise for the class and instructor. Include facts not feelings or opinions. Be sincere and don’t plead.
